title: Penile cancer: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
abstract: Penile cancer can occur in all men, but people with the disease often fall in their 60s. Abnormal symptoms occur in the skin of the penis, scrotum, and foreskin (if uncircumcised); If accompanied by lymphadenopathy, men need to go to the Department of Andrology and Urology as soon as possible.
content:
Penile cancer: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention

Penile cancer can occur in all men, but people with the disease often fall in their 60s. Abnormal symptoms occur in the skin of the penis, scrotum, and foreskin (if uncircumcised); If accompanied by lymphadenopathy, men need to go to the Department of Andrology and Urology as soon as possible.

What is penile cancer?
Penile cancer occurs when cells grow out of control outside or in a man's penis. The disease often starts from skin cells, but "seeds" can also appear inside the penis. (first)
Penile cancer is rare, but if detected early, it can be completely treated.
Penile cancer is divided into the following types:
1. Squamous cell carcinoma
Squamous cell carcinoma accounts for 95% of penile cancer cases. The disease often appears in the outermost layer of skin, so it is called carcinoma. However, the disease can also progress in other parts of the penis.
2. Basal cell carcinoma
In contrast to squamous cell carcinoma, basal cell carcinoma occurs in the final layer of the epithelium. The characteristic of this form of cancer is that it grows slowly and is unable to spread to other areas of the body.
3. Melanoma
It is a form of cancer that begins in the cells that give skin its color, also called melanocytes.
4. Sarcoma
Sarcoma is a term used to describe cancers that start in bones and soft tissues. For penile cancer, signs form in tissues such as blood vessels, muscle and fat.

Risk factors and causes of penile cancer
To date, the main cause of penile cancer is still unclear. However, scientists have found that men with the following factors have a higher risk of getting the disease. They include: (2)
Human papilloma virus (HPV) present (3); Over age 60; Smoke; Have a weakened immune system due to HIV/AIDS (4); Without circumcision, fluid and other substances can accumulate under the foreskin, increasing the likelihood of developing cancer; Men with phimosis cause this part to become tight and difficult to clean, leading to the accumulation of fluid and residue; Treated psoriasis with psoralen and ultraviolet (UV) light

Signs of penile cancer
Changes in the skin of the penis are the most common symptom of penile cancer. Signs may appear on the foreskin (uncircumcised men), on the head of the penis or on the shaft of the penis.
Symptoms of penile cancer include:
Change in penile skin thickness or color; Rash or small scaly bumps on the penis; Lumps on the penis; Foul-smelling discharge under the foreskin; Feeling pain, possibly bleeding during erection or during sex; Swelling of the penis; Lumps under the skin in the groin area
However, these symptoms are not always considered a warning of penile cancer. Infectious problems or allergic reactions can also cause the above symptoms. Therefore, it is necessary to see a specialist in Andrology - Urology so that the doctor can review and give appropriate treatment.

Symptoms of penile cancer by stage
Penile cancer is divided into 4 stages, according to test results. Each stage has different manifestations. Specifically:
Stage 0: Initially only appears on the top layer of the skin with mild changes in skin color in the private area; sharp pain/dull pain in the penis (more painful when erect or touched); small cauliflower-shaped ulcers; pain, burning sensation; The discharge has a foul odor. At this stage, penile cancer can spread to lymph nodes or other parts of the body.; Stage 1: On the outside, the ulcers have increased in size and deepened. Skin shows signs of necrosis; secrete mucus, cloudy, foul smell. At this time, the cancer has spread to the connective tissue under the skin, possibly spreading to glands, lymph nodes or other parts of the body.; Stage 2: In addition to the same symptoms as stage 1, entering this stage, cancer cells may have spread to the erectile tissues or urethra; other parts of the body.; Stage 3: Cancer has spread to the connective tissue under the skin, lymph vessels, and blood vessels. Cancer cells may even have spread to the erectile tissues, urethra, lymph nodes in the groin (hard enlarged inguinal lymph nodes) and other parts of the body.; Stage 4 (final stage): The patient now loses weight, is exhausted, loses appetite, vomits blood... Cancer cells have also spread to areas near the penis such as the pubic bone, scrotum under the penis, even spread to other areas and organs of the body.

Is penile cancer dangerous?
Penile cancer is dangerous but can be treated. If stage 0 or 1 penile cancer is detected, still limited to the penis, from the time of diagnosis, the 5-year survival rate is about 85% after surgery. In stages 3 and 4, the 5-year survival rate is about 59%. If cancer metastasizes to distant parts of the body, the 5-year survival rate is 11%.
Therefore, depending on when cancer is detected, the earlier it is detected, the higher the chance of curing it and preserving the "little guy". If detected slowly, the patient's life time will be shortened.

When to see a doctor?
Men who see any signs of penile cancer (mentioned above) or have the following factors should also see a Andrologist regularly:
Have ever had a penile injury, urinary tract infection or genital warts; Foreskin stenosis but not circumcised; Diagnosed with urethral stricture

Diagnosis of penile cancer
The doctor will do a physical examination and ask about symptoms. If necessary, the doctor will prescribe the patient to perform tests such as:
Biopsy: The doctor will take a small tissue sample from the damaged area on the skin of the penis to check for cancer cells.; Imaging tests such as X-rays, CT scans, ultrasounds, and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) to look for tumors or other signs that the cancer has spread to other parts of the body.

Penile cancer treatment
If the cancer is in its early stages, treatment may include:
The medicine is in the form of a skin cream; Cryotherapy, a procedure that uses extremely cold liquid or a device to freeze and destroy cancerous tissue; Mohs surgery removes affected skin layer by layer until healthy tissue is reached; Laser to cut and destroy cancerous areas; Circumcision surgery if cancer is only on the foreskin

Measures to prevent penile cancer
According to the advice of Andrologists, men should follow the following precautions:
Men over the age of 60 should regularly check themselves for changes in their private areas (especially the skin).; Regular health check-ups every 6 months at medical facilities specializing in andrology and oncology to screen for penile cancer when there are risk factors, etc. to detect early signs of cancer and timely intervention.; Maintain a healthy sex life, use condoms to avoid infection with HPV, HIV or other bacteria and viruses that cause balanitis; Do not smoke or abuse alcohol; Daily exercise; Healthy eating; Avoid stress and exposure to toxic chemicals
In addition, circumcision right from birth has been proven and recognized as a measure that can effectively help prevent penile cancer for men.
Center for Urology and Nephrology, Department of Andrology - Urology of Tam Anh General Hospital System brings together a team of leading experts, Internal Medicine and Surgery, skilled and dedicated.
People's Teacher Prof. Dr. Tran Quan Anh, Meritorious Physician Associate Prof. Dr. Vu Le Chuyen are giants in the field of Urology and Nephrology in Vietnam. Along with the names of excellent physicians Dr. Nguyen The Truong, excellent physicians Doctor II Ta Phuong Dung, Dr. Nguyen Hoang Duc, Dr. Tu Thanh Tri Dung, MSc.CKI Nguyen Duc Nhuan, BS.CKII Nguyen Le Tuyen, MSc.Nguyen Tan Cuong, BS.CKII Dinh Cam Tu, BS.CKII Ngo Dong Dung, BS.CKII Vo Thi Kim Thanh MSc. Ta Ngoc Thach, BS.CKI Phan Truong Nam...
The Center's experts and doctors are always confident in mastering the latest techniques, early detecting and effectively treating kidney and urinary tract diseases, helping patients shorten hospital stays and limit risk of recurrence, improving quality of life.
With the leading modern machinery and equipment system in the country and the region; Operating room meets international standards; Along with a 5-star boarding area and high-class service... The Urology and Nephrology Center stands out with examination, screening and treatment services for all urinary tract diseases. From common surgeries to major high-tech surgeries.
These include laparoscopic kidney stone surgery, kidney transplant, tumor resection to preserve kidney parenchyma; Radical nephrectomy; Radical prostatectomy; total bladder resection and small bowel cystoplasty; adrenalectomy; shaping urinary tract defects... Diagnosis - medical and surgical treatment of all diseases.
To schedule an examination and treatment with leading experts at the Center for Urology and Nephrology, Department of Andrology - Urology, Tam Anh General Hospital System, you can make an appointment online through the following ways:
Call the hotline 0287 102 6789 - 093 180 6858 (HCMC) or 024 3872 3872 - 024 7106 6858 (Hanoi) to register for a private medical appointment with a specialist, through the customer service staff.; Register for a medical appointment with any doctor you trust at the link: https://tamanhhospital.vn/danh-cho-khach-hang/dat-lich-kham/; Send a message on Tam Anh General Hospital Fanpage or Tam Anh General Hospital Urology and Andrology Fanpage; Text message via Zalo OA of Tam Anh General Hospital.
Through this article, everyone will probably understand more about penile cancer. The disease is dangerous but can still be treated if detected early. Therefore, if you experience unusual signs, quickly contact your doctor to be examined and monitor the situation as soon as possible.

Center for Urology and Nephrology, Department of Andrology - Urology of Tam Anh General Hospital System brings together a team of leading experts, Internal Medicine and Surgery, skilled and dedicated.
People's Teacher Prof. Dr. Tran Quan Anh, Meritorious Physician Associate Prof. Dr. Vu Le Chuyen are giants in the field of Urology and Nephrology in Vietnam. Along with the names of excellent physicians Dr. Nguyen The Truong, excellent physicians Doctor II Ta Phuong Dung, Dr. Nguyen Hoang Duc, Dr. Tu Thanh Tri Dung, MSc.CKI Nguyen Duc Nhuan, BS.CKII Nguyen Le Tuyen, MSc.Nguyen Tan Cuong, BS.CKII Dinh Cam Tu, BS.CKII Ngo Dong Dung, BS.CKII Vo Thi Kim Thanh MSc. Ta Ngoc Thach, BS.CKI Phan Truong Nam...
The Center's experts and doctors are always confident in mastering the latest techniques, early detecting and effectively treating kidney and urinary tract diseases, helping patients shorten hospital stays and limit risk of recurrence, improving quality of life.
With the leading modern machinery and equipment system in the country and the region; Operating room meets international standards; Along with a 5-star boarding area and high-class service... The Urology and Nephrology Center stands out with examination, screening and treatment services for all urinary tract diseases. From common surgeries to major high-tech surgeries.
These include laparoscopic kidney stone surgery, kidney transplant, tumor resection to preserve kidney parenchyma; Radical nephrectomy; Radical prostatectomy; total bladder resection and small bowel cystoplasty; adrenalectomy; shaping urinary tract defects... Diagnosis - medical and surgical treatment of all diseases.
To schedule an examination and treatment with leading experts at the Center for Urology and Nephrology, Department of Andrology - Urology, Tam Anh General Hospital System, you can make an appointment online through the following ways:
Call the hotline 0287 102 6789 - 093 180 6858 (HCMC) or 024 3872 3872 - 024 7106 6858 (Hanoi) to register for a private medical appointment with a specialist, through the customer service staff.; Register for a medical appointment with any doctor you trust at the link: https://tamanhhospital.vn/danh-cho-khach-hang/dat-lich-kham/; Send a message on Tam Anh General Hospital Fanpage or Tam Anh General Hospital Urology and Andrology Fanpage; Text message via Zalo OA of Tam Anh General Hospital.
